definition: Xu Xiake (1587-1641), Ming dynasty travel writer and geographer, author of Xu Xiake's Travel Diaries 徐霞客遊記|徐霞客游记[Xu2 Xia2 ke4 You2 ji4]
slowly/gently
surname Xu
rose-tinted sky or clouds at sunrise or sunset
customer/visitor/guest
Xu Xiake's Travel Diaries, a book of travel records by 徐霞客[Xu2 Xia2 ke4] on geology, geography, plants etc

sentences.english: During his lifetime, Xu Xiahe visited 16 provinces, leaving his footsteps everywhere across the land.
sentences.chinese: 徐霞客一生考察了十六個省，足跡幾乎遍及全國。

sentences.english: Xu Xiake toured and investigated 16 provinces in his lifetime, covering almost the whole of China/ the whole country.
sentences.chinese: 徐霞客一生周遊考察了十六個省，足跡幾乎遍及全國。

sentences.english: As recorded in the book, the first place Xu traveled to was Taintai Mountain in Tiantai County, Zhejiang Province.
sentences.chinese: 據史料記載，徐霞客首遊地點爲浙江省天台山。
